content: Hello FHIR Implementers. I have a question re: MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.doseAndRate. The spec says this is an Element (and based on the structure, I am thinking it is an Element). But when I hover over the doseAndRate icon in the spec, it says it is a Resource. Please see attached screenshot. Can anyone clarify? Thank you! Screen-Shot-2020-06-24-at-10.35.53-AM.png
@Brett Marquard / @Eric Haas - any insight on the above doseAndRate question?

what version of FHIR are you looking at. Here is what I see when I hover on FHIR R4 Dosage type:
Screen-Shot-2020-06-24-at-10.41.58-AM.png
Yes, that is FHIR R4 and I get the hover that I posted. The hover is the Definition of the element, so I'm not sure why you would be seeing "Resource".
the link is to us core med request, everyone on my team is seeing Resource on hover. weird...
no, the specific link you are looking at is the Dosage datatype in R4. If you clock on the US Core MedRequest dosageInstruction element, that links to the R4 Dosage datatype.
we don't redefine the hover content in US Core so that is inherited from the base. I get the same as Jean. I am not sure why yours is different. Which browser are you using
The hover for the icon before the text "doseAndRate" is 'Resource' in that link, pretty sure that's what they're looking at
yes the little icons all have hovers. That is a ig-publisher defined I never noticed that before...
will make a tracker to update that to say 'Element '
